metadata.Title: CVE-2019-13616 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - low
metadata.Description:
SDL (Simple DirectMedia Layer) through 1.2.15 and 2.x through 2.0.9 has aheap-based buffer over-read in BlitNtoN in video/SDL_blit_N.c when calledfrom SDL_SoftBlit in video/SDL_blit.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-13616` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsdl2-2.0-0 - 2.0.10+dfsg1-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

libsdl1.2debian - 1.2.15+dfsg2-5
No subscription required

libsdl2-image-2.0-0 - 2.0.5+dfsg1-2
No subscription required

libsdl-image1.2 - 1.2.12-12
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libsdl2 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.0.10+dfsg1-1ubuntu1').
libsdl1.2 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.2.15+dfsg2-5').
libsdl2-image package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.0.5+dfsg1-2').
sdl-image1.2 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.2.12-12').
